column4: BlueKaj: md5 sum... Hm... The USB installer didn't say anything about md5 summing anything. Any md5 sum programs you could recommend me?
why the f:\? should just be, md5sum nameof.iso
md5sums of iso is one thing. How do I know if the USB stick is different from the iso in any way?
well, the iso you have, was that burning to the usb stick?
I think so. I used Universal USB Installer to put the iso onto the stick in order to install ubuntu onto a computer.
ok, then the md5sum from that iso should match up with the md5sum on the ubuntu website for that iso version, which would then mean that if all is well, the usb stick should be ok.
Not finding any md5 numbers on the download page of http://www.ubuntu.com/desktop/get-ubuntu/download
better yet, use this one, it's for cd's not dvd's. - http://mirror.mcs.anl.gov/pub/ubuntu-iso/CDs-Ubuntu/lucid/
Ok. In 25 minutes I'll see if there is any MD5 difference, and then try that on the stick.
Ok, download complete, and I see that the MD5s between the 2 ISOs are very different.
Gonna now attempt to install the new copy.
Success on the installing. Lets see if it runs. ;)
Ok, it is working. Now to see if I can get to some restricted drives or whatever. :S
